title: 112_hr3672
content:
For the fiscal year ending September 30, 2012, $6.4 billion is appropriated for disaster relief fund under the Federal Emergency Management Agency for major disasters. The Department of the Army's Corps of Engineers is responsible for the Mississippi River and its tributaries. The Department of the Army's Corps of Engineers is allocated $802,000,000 for repair of damages to Federal projects along the Mississippi River and its tributaries due to disasters. The funds are designated for disaster relief and require monthly reports on allocation and obligation. The Congress allocates $534,000,000 for dredging navigation channels and repairing Corps projects damaged by disasters. The funds are designated for disaster relief and require monthly reports on allocation and obligation. The Congress allocates $388,000,000 for flood control and coastal emergencies, authorized by the Act of August 18, 1941. The funds are designated for disaster relief under the Stafford Disaster Relief Act, with monthly reports required on allocation and obligation. The Senate must provide monthly reports on the allocation and obligation of funds for disaster relief under the Stafford Disaster Relief Act, starting within 60 days of this Act's enactment. TITLE II--COMBATING WASTE, FRAUD, AND ABUSE: Social Security Administration's limitation on administrative expenses. The additional amount for continuing disability reviews and redeterminations of eligibility under titles II and XVI of the Social Security Act is limited to $483,484,000. This funding is specified as new budget authority for fiscal year 2012 under the Balanced Budget and Emergency Deficit Control Act of 1985. TITLE III--GENERAL PROVISION

Sec. 301. Each amount appropriated in this Act is in addition to amounts otherwise appropriated for the fiscal year. This Act may be cited as the "Disaster Relief Appropriations Act, 2012". Speaker of the House of Representatives. Vice President of the United States and President of the Senate.
